context: The MICs for each antibiotic were determined at the point of intersection of growth of the elliptical margin zone with the MIC scale value on the Etest strips. MIC≧1 μg/ml for clarithromycin and levofloxacin were considered to be resistant to H. pylori.H. pylori status and diagnosis H. pylori status was studied by culture, and histology (two biopsy samples of the gastric greater curvatures of antrum and mid-corpus were examined with haematoxylin–eosin and Giemsa stain) at endoscopy before second-line therapy. H. pylori positive status was based on both positive examinations. Cure of H. pylori infection was defined by the 13C-urea breath test (13C-UBT: cut-off value was settled at Δ2.5‰ 20 min after taking 100 mg 13C-urea), culture, and histology 4 to 8 weeks after completion of second-line therapy. The judgement of successful eradication was based on negative results in all tests.Statistical analysis Eradication rates were calculated by both intention-to-treat and per-protocol analyses. Point estimates are given as means with 95% CIs (confidence intervals).
